byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Katie Shepherd and Jasmine Aguilera from Washington, Liz Robbins and Samantha Schmidt from New York, and Fernanda Santos from Phoenix.

abstract: Many families of undocumented immigrants fear they will be deported after Supreme Court announced it is divided in case concerning Pres Obama's executive actions intended to shield illegal immigrants from deportation.
snippet: The deadlocked Supreme Court’s ruling against President Obama left many immigrants fearful of deportation, but others said they would continue their fight....
lead_paragraph: The deadlocked Supreme Court’s ruling against President Obama left many immigrants fearful of deportation, but others said they would continue their fight.

headline.main: Tears Flow and Spirits Sag, but Some Immigrants Look to November With Determination
headline.print_headline: As Tears Flow and Spirits Sag, Some Look to November With Determination
